summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from July 2024 discussing a tasking from the Director's Office (OCA) for background on the Epstein investigation timeline and flight logs. It provides a summary of key events, including the 2007 non-prosecution agreement by Alex Acosta, FBI Miami's continued investigation, a 2011 victim follow-up, a 2016 civil attorney referral to SDNY, and the 2019 prosecution. It also includes a transcript of a June 2024 Senate hearing exchange between Senator John Kennedy and FBI Director Christopher Wray.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.role: Former US Attorney for the Southern District of Florida
persons.context: Mentioned as the then-US Attorney who made the non-prosecution agreement with Jeffrey Epstein and his lawyers, which led to the FBI Miami case becoming pending inactive.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the FBI investigations discussed. Referenced regarding the 2007 non-prosecution agreement, the investigation into CSAM, and his flight logs.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Quoted in a transcript from a June 2024 Senate Appropriations hearing, responding to Senator Kennedy's questions about the FBI's investigation into Epstein and associates.

persons.name: John Kennedy
persons.context: Quoted in a transcript questioning FBI Director Wray during a June 2024 Senate hearing about the FBI's investigation into other people involved in Epstein's sex trafficking ring and the existence of alleged tapes.

connections.description: Acosta, as US Attorney, made a non-prosecution agreement with Epstein and his lawyers.
Director Wray, representing the FBI, is questioned about and confirms active investigations related to Epstein.
Senator Kennedy questions Director Wray during a Senate hearing about the scope of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Then-US Attorney Alex Acosta made a deal with Jeffrey Epstein and his lawyers, leading the FBI Miami case to become officially pending inactive, though FBI Miami disagreed and continued investigating.

events.title: Victim Follow-up Investigation
events.description: FBI Miami followed up on information received when a victim who was originally not spoken with came forward. The case was taken to a different Florida district, but the USAO declined to prosecute.

events.title: Civil Attorneys Referral to SDNY
events.description: Civil attorneys for victims approached SDNY Assistant US Attorneys regarding a civil suit claiming CVRA violations, presenting information that Epstein should be criminally investigated. No investigation was opened at that time.

events.title: Senate Appropriations Hearing
events.description: Senator John Kennedy questioned FBI Director Christopher Wray about the FBI's investigation into other people involved in Epstein's sex trafficking ring and the alleged existence of surveillance tapes.

events.title: Tasking Deadline for Investigation Timeline
events.description: The FBI's Criminal Investigative Division was tasked with providing a timeline and summary of the entire Epstein investigation to the Director's Office by close of business.

keyFacts: FBI Miami's investigation became officially 'pending inactive' due to the 2007 non-prosecution agreement orchestrated by then-US Attorney Alex Acosta, despite FBI Miami's disagreement.
FBI Miami continued investigating after the agreement, including a follow-up in 2011 with a new victim, but a different USAO district declined to prosecute.
In 2016, civil attorneys for victims presented information to SDNY AUSAs for a potential criminal investigation into Epstein, but no action was taken at that time.
The document includes a 2024 Senate hearing transcript where Senator Kennedy presses Director Wray on investigating Epstein's associates and the alleged existence of blackmail tapes.
The email chain itself is a 2024 internal FBI tasking to compile a full timeline and summary of the Epstein investigation for the FBI Director's background.
